3 Penyelam China Hilang di Pulau Sangiang, Polisi Periksa Kapten Kapal
05 Nov 2019, 14:08 by Ahmad Bil Wahid
Jakarta - Polisi masih menyelidiki kasus hilangnya tiga warga negara China di Pulau Sangiang, Banten. Kapten kapal yang mengangkut tiga WN China itu diperiksa.
"Masih dilakukan pencarian, pendalaman, pemeriksaan-pemeriksaan terhadap kapten kapal. Masih kita dalami," kata Kapolda Banten Irjen Tomsi Tohir di Mabes Polri, Jalan Trunojoyo, Jakarta Selatan, Selasa (5/11/2019).
Pencarian tiga WN China melibatkan tim dari Basarnas hingga Ditpolair. Alat pencarian bawah laut juga telah digunakan.
"Basarnas, AL, Ditpolair. Kita sudah kerahkan alat untuk mencari di bawah laut," ujarnya.
Sebelumnya, Kepala Kantor Basarnas Banten Zainal Arifin mengatakan para korban sudah sering melakukan penyelaman di sekitar Banten, termasuk Pulau Sangiang.
"Yang jelas korban yang dinyatakan hilang ini adalah penyelam profesional, bukan pemula. Mereka sudah punya kualifikasi selam, bahkan berkali-kali mungkin melaksanakan selam di sini," katanya kepada wartawan di Merak, Senin (4/11).
Total ada tujuh orang yang ikut dalam rombongan. Enam orang menyelam di perairan Pulau Sangiang yang dibagi ke dalam dua grup penyelam. Ketiga orang tersebut hilang saat akan kembali ke permukaan setelah menyelam.

(abw/fdn)

3 Chinese Divers Missing on Sangiang Island, Police Inspect Ship Captain
05 Nov 2019, 14:08 by Ahmad Bil Wahid
Jakarta - Police are still investigating the case of the disappearance of three Chinese citizens on Sangiang Island, Banten. The captain of the ship carrying three Chinese citizens was examined.
"Still searching, deepening, examinations of the captain of the ship. We are still investigating," said Banten Police Chief Inspector General Tomsi Tohir at Police Headquarters, Jalan Trunojoyo, South Jakarta, Tuesday (11/05/2019).
The search for three Chinese citizens involved teams from Basarnas to Ditpolair. An underwater search tool has also been used.
"Basarnas, AL, Ditpolair. We have deployed tools to search under the sea," he said.
Previously, the Head of the Banten Basarnas Office Zainal Arifin said the victims had often dived around Banten, including Sangiang Island.
"What is clear is that the missing victims are professional divers, not beginners. They already have diving qualifications, and may even carry out diving here many times," he told reporters at Merak, Monday (4/11).
A total of seven people joined the group. Six people dive in Sangiang Island waters which are divided into two groups of divers. The three men disappeared when they returned to the surface after diving.

(abw / fdn)
